description: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy response header allows web site administrators to control resources the user agent is allowed to load for a given page. With a few exceptions, policies mostly involve specifying server origins and script endpoints. This helps guard against cross-site scripting attacks.

response-directives.description: Specifies the default URL that other directives can be relative to.
response-directives.details: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) base-uri directive restricts the URLs that can be used in a document's <base> element. This directive helps to mitigate attacks that rely on the use of a malicious base URL.

response-directives.description: Prevents loading any assets using HTTP when the page is served over HTTPS.
response-directives.details: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) block-all-mixed-content directive instructs user agents to prevent loading any assets using HTTP when the page is served over HTTPS.

response-directives.description: Specifies valid sources for web workers and nested browsing contexts loaded using elements such as <frame> and <iframe>.
response-directives.details: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) child-src directive specifies the valid sources for web workers and nested browsing contexts loaded using elements such as <frame> and <iframe>.

response-directives.description: Specifies valid sources for fetch, XMLHttpRequest, and WebSockets connections.
response-directives.details: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) connect-src directive specifies the valid sources for fetch, XMLHttpRequest, and WebSockets connections.

response-directives.description: Specifies valid sources for any directive that doesn't have a specific directive.
response-directives.details: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) default-src directive specifies the valid sources for any directive that doesn't have a specific directive.

response-directives.description: Specifies valid sources for fonts loaded using @font-face.
response-directives.details: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) font-src directive specifies the valid sources for fonts loaded using @font-face.

response-directives.description: Specifies valid URLs that can be used as the action of HTML forms.
response-directives.details: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) form-action directive specifies the valid URLs that can be used as the action of HTML forms.

response-directives.description: Specifies valid parents that may embed a page using <frame>, <iframe>, <object>, <embed>, or <applet>.
response-directives.details:
The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) frame-ancestors directive specifies valid parents that may embed a page using <frame>, <iframe>, <object>, <embed>, or <applet>.

Setting this directive to 'none' is similar to X-Frame-Options: deny (which is also supported in older browsers).
The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) frame-src specifies valid sources for nested browsing contexts loading using elements such as <frame> and <iframe>.
